That was my first clue to stop watching but I did not.I cannot tell you what happened and really do not care to have it explained(plus ending will piss you off).Take a pass on this one, regardless if Netflix recommends it.

reviews.review_title: It stops making sense about thirty minutes in and never recovers.
reviews.content: When she helps her father (Willem Dafoe) broker an arms deal, a reporter (Anne Hathaway) becomes involved in the story she's trying to break. You will have no idea what's going on more than half of the time. You won't just not care about the characters to begin with - you'll come out the other side caring even less. It tries to keep you guessing to pose as a thriller, but you just are left feeling like you have no idea what's going on at all. Hathaway is really trying to bring some soul into Elena McMahon and she certainly might have in another version of The Last Thing He Wanted. Her character is a breast cancer survivor, single mother, and stick-to-her-guns D. C. journalist. The movie is so committed to mirroring how tedious the assignment she is on is, though, that the movie's tone takes a major blow. Then there's CIA official Treat Morrison (Ben Affleck) who speaks slowly and has a glum face. He has something like five lines in The Last Thing He Wanted, and never has the actor resembled a brick more. The movie attempts to push him and Anne Hathaway as a romantic pairing, and it's so completely out of nowhere. When there's a twist in the relationship between the two, there's not enough built upon between them for it have any type of effect on anything. It's frustrating how little the film seems to care about who is watching. The Last Thing He Wanted is a waste of time, and it's among the last thing you'll want to watch on Netflix.

Till the halfway mark most of the things went really well within the movie, a hotshot no nonsense journalist, pulled of a hot zone and trust into covering a presidential election campaign gets bored and meets her estranged father. Things get really tense as she discovers her father was a gun runner and has a million dollars due to him which she could collect. So she lands in the insurgency ridden badlands of Latin America and the Caribbean and is sent on a wild goose chase only to discover time and again that she has been set up. Sounds cool right?The movie falters at the halfway mark as huge cracks starts to appear in the plot and it becomes terribly messy time and again. I thought everything would add up in the end but to my horror nothing of that sort happened and the entire story fell apart so pathetically.Anne Hathaway delivers a stellar performance but this would go unnoticed as the movie becomes a dud. Ben affleck wasted his time doing this movie. Every Technical aspect of the movie is brilliant expect the writing. I don't understand how the producers expected the audience to understand the movie after the final cut.It would be actually weird to recommend the movie to anyone other than Anne Hathaway fans.

reviews.review_title: The Last Thing He Wanted(2020) BAD

Accents, my God, I understand, if you don't speak any other language than English spanish will sound spanish no matter where, but this is just stupid, is a Netflix movie, released in Latin America and they have "cuban" and "puerto rican" accents for Spanish speakers in the movie. They also use Mexican lingo, that are not proper for the countries showed, this is just DISRESPECTFUL.
Just imagine, what will the audience would feel if I show a story in England and use Irish accent with Irish lingo, is just disrespectful and STUPID.
The are also not respecting distances, showing her landing in Nicaragua and traveling all the way to San José, at least a 5 hour drive AND without doing any border control (Yes, Nicaragua and Costa Rica are two different countries), that not so say she drove not having a map, or knowing the stretch, and WITH NO PASSPORT.So, boring movie, with lack of respect and with a story that makes NO SENSE at all.
I see what they tried to do, and the type of movie they wanted to release, but it is a complete FAIL.

Yep, this plot is likely to confuse those who have forgotten the US operation in the 1980s to illegally funnel arms to the Contras in Nicaragua using off-the-books cash. It's also likely to confuse those who don't understand that the CIA and US State Department routinely work together to manage public perception of reality, with the former doing some serious dirtywork whenever necessary. In that context, this movie makes perfect sense and works well. I agree that her going on the trip for her father's arms deal was a bit dubious (but it was not completely ridiculous, given his dire predicament and her previous experience in the region). Like many other movies that reference regional politics and the duplicity of a western power, the viewer must struggle right along with the protagonist to uncover the truth of what's going on. I found it well worth the effort.

Confusing, disjointed, impossible to follow.
All the good reviews are people saying " I am actually smart enough to understand it" in a pathetic way to make themselves feel good.
Rushed content to forfill the billion subscribers empty mouths. Terrible from start to finish

reviews.review_title: Do yourself a huge favour, DON'T WATCH THIS GARBAGE
reviews.content: Wow, 2 hours of my life wasted on one of the worst movies I've seen in at least, the last 10 years. Utter garbage

reviews.review_title: Confused plot, odd sequencing. Did the editors cut important scenes? Scratching my head.
reviews.content:
Anne Hathaway is a reporter determined to investigate how US military surplus arms end up in Nicaragua. Rosie Perez is her colleague & pal, a photographer.
Willem Dafoe, her father, asks for her help with a business deal. Throwing in a weak sub-plot, Anne as a single-mom who put her child in boarding school adds little. Ben Affleck is a politician. That's about all I could fathom from this disjointed story.I'm very disappointed that Didion couldn't come up with a better screenplay based on her own novel (which I have not read.) I expected more - like an intelligible story line. Hathaway, Perez & Dafoe did their best. Affleck gave a flat-affect performance. Perhaps his character was written that way? Nice scenery.An aside: this is the first time I've seen Hathaway without makeup to cover freckles I didn't know she had.

I rarely review, but felt compelled to in order to save others from this waste of time. A friend recommended this film to me - halfway through I called him to confirm it was a wind-up!
Firstly, there's no way of including spoilers. To do so you'd need to comprehend a single part of the story, which is impossible.
Within the first 10 minutes you feel like it's started halfway through and you've missed an hour of explanations, scene setting and character profiling. Every new scene feels as if 5 scenes were missed which may actually give any idea of who is who and what is happening.
I've genuinely never watched anything so bad. It's impossible to explain what this film was about - it's like they filmed 4 different films and threw a load of random scenes together. Horrific!

Paused this about 16 times to do other things, like chores.The speed-talking ultra-journo-signaling dialogue at the onset was annoying. Although there were moments of med-low level intrigue, the politics were almost an aside. The idea that an intelligent person would just march into a weapons deal alone, knowing practically nothing, and having no connections to the players, or any position, power, or leverage is idiotic.Anne Hathaway & Rosie Perez were good in this, for the material they had to work with. Willem Dafoe did his best with a repetitive, depth-free role. Ben Affleck playing a smug and smarmy a-hole seems on point, but the character was basically flat. The portrayal of the journo either trusting or getting in bed with him is inexplicable.Yet AGAIN, there's depiction of animal cruelty and senseless murder! Is there a single dramatic production that doesn't have these things solely for the sake of emotional manipulation? It's sick, disgusting and lazy AF.At least Puerto Rico got something out of the filming.(It's laughable that someone's blaming Joan Didion for this - it's only BASED on her work - she didn't create this.)

When I decided to watch the movie I immediately noticed that almost all the reviews were bad. I guessed that the multitude of negative reviews were politically motivated as the plot was supposedly about Regan Era foreign policies. I have to admit that I guessed wrong. This was one of the worst films I have ever seen. The plot was so thin that it was almost nonexistent. Pretty scenery pretty people that is about all the film had going for it.

reviews.review_title: Eh? ..... WTH was that all about!
reviews.content: So.... before reaching halfway of the movie, I didn't have a clue what was going on.I reached halfway, no change.I got to the end. Nah, no change.What a load of rubbish.

The only reason I made it all the way through this movie is because I am a fan of Anne Hathaway. After about a half hour I gave up hope that a coherent story would emerge. Instead I just turned off my brain and watched Anne.

Joan Didion is one of my all-time favourite writers - for her essays, which I imagine I'll still be re-reading decades from now. But has there ever been a good movie made from a Didion novel? I've seen two and they were both terrible in a way that makes you wonder who could have been drunk enough and still kept a job long enough to commission them. And I've read more of her novels than that and they don't work and neither, to any significant extent, did any of her screenplays as movies. By the by, I've also heard or read her saying she did screenplays because they paid well and they were 'easy,' which I guess shows you her level of commitment there. But I think she cared about the novels, which, well, what can I say?Didion is a genius prose stylist and a great, acerbic analyst of American society's absurdities and sicknesses. Even in her novels, she finds a little space to get her licks in in these respects, but this, it turns out, is not material suitable for the screen. There's a long passage of voiceover near the start of this movie lifted straight from the book, probably because the screenwriters were as impressed as I generally am with her voice. It's fascinating just how badly it works on screen and shocking that no one stepped in to cut the hell out of it once that became clear. It's sludge and tangle: dull, confusing, almost impossible to follow and devoid of relevance to what we're seeing.So skip this and do yourself the generous favour of reading Didion's essays. You could start with her piece, from Slouching Towards Bethlehem, on Hollywood: 'I Can't Get That Monster Out of my Mind'.

Why does an unexperienced director get handed one of the classic novels of our time and get permission to add characters and hack it up? The way this story is told, it needed handling properly. Anne Hathaway and Toby Jones are the saving graces, Hathaway dressed in Didion-perfect outfits each scene - but Elena is not Didion in the book! Didion is more like the Rosie Perez character, the narrator! So it's a mess, leaving out the reasons for why she has to wait in the town, why she has to do the run for her dad, and instead of using all the reasons in the book, the director has the gall to make up her own flimsy excuses! What a wasted opportunity. I don't know how we're supposed to believe the bloated Weinstein-esque Ben Affleck would get to sleep with Anne Hathaway. What are all these Good Old Boy government scenes? Was it too hard to tell a story from the woman's POV? And they changed the ending! Arghhhhh! Joan Didion must be so cross. If you didn't like the book's story, don't make it into a film!

This is my first review and I've been saving this moment to celebrate one of the greatest movies or TV shows I watch, but this... this is just...
This is the last thing I wanted.The script is... a first draft? I fell asleep twice.
Not even the best actors could have saved this.

I made two bad decisions when watching this movie. The first was to watch it in the first place.Half-way through, I stopped for dinner. I then made another bad decision, I went back and watched the remainder of it. I had a chance and I didn't take it.Some reviewer wrote that they understood it all and gave it a 10, but then didn't know whether Ben Affleck was CIA or not. That summed it up for me. You can understand the background of the Reagan administration, the Contras, the role of investigative journalism and cover-ups. Then you watch this and say why did so many people make such terrible decisions (like me!)? Why was the plot so convoluted?There has to be a beginning, a middle and an end. They don't have to be in that order, but any book or film needs that. There has be some understanding of characters motivations (there was very little). The plot has to make some sort of sense at some point. It didn't for me.I had an understanding of the Anne Hathaway character at the start, a clever, battle-hardened journalist in search of uncovering a story and a web of corruption.Everything after that pointed to a naïve wet-behind the ears woman who got herself into serious scrapes that she had no real concept of what to do in. Even when there was a way out and no point to continuing whatever quest she was on, or trust any of the dubious characters around her, she continued to do so. Sometimes after realising how dodgy a character was, she trusted them again.Bizarre, convoluted, tried to be clever and wasn't. Save yourself a couple of hours. Go and watch paint dry - it will make more sense.
Okay so what did I watch!!? Don't get it at all. Too bad I looked up the movie after watching. The rating says it all. Don't waste your time
Nope I won't ever see this movie again!! I only watched this to see Anne and Ben...those two were not meant for this crap movie! Don't be putting Anne Hathaway and Ben Affleck in CRAP MOVIES!

What's the capital of Costa Rica? Who was president of the United States at the beginning of the Cold War? Name one country which shares a border with Thailand. If you can't answer these three questions, then there are extreme limits to how much you'll like this movie. It's not because these questions reveal required knowledge for watching this movie. It's because this movie caters to a certain type of individual, and if you can't answer the mentioned three questions, then your interests probably don't align with the targeted audience for this movie.This movie is primarily for those who are really interested in politics, world history, and government. If social studies was your favorite subject in school, you're pretty good at Trivial Pursuit, and you're highly interested in current world news affairs, then this movie may be for you. If not, then probably not.I don't fit the demographic which I've just described. I have a moderate interest in politics, but not much more than the average person, and I had no real interest in social studies, when I was in school. However, I do love movies, and I also enjoy a good thriller.This movie isn't much of a thriller. It has a few thriller aspects, but the movie isn't driven by them. It certainly would have been possible to tell this story without focusing so heavily on the interests of the targeted demographic. Quite a few movies have successfully done it. However, this movie doesn't even try."The Bourne Identity" is a perfect example of what I'm talking about. It's a thriller that deals with certain government issues and topics, however, it's written in such a way that the audience can enjoy it without having to be deeply engaged in such issues. "The Bourne Identity" comes off as very authentic, in terms of the mentioned issues, however, the movie isn't driven by those issues. It primarily focuses on being a thriller and telling a story that a broader audience can relate to, easily understand, and be entertained by. In other words, you can watch it without having to have a deeper interest in any particular topic, like government, politics, or history. This particular movie doesn't offer that.For me, this movie's greatest strength is in its professionalism. It was made with seasoned, professional actors and a professional filmmaker. All of the performances are extremely solid, as you would expect from the big-name actors which appear in this film. You can easily watch it without feeling as if any of them are acting. This is something audience members often take for granted until you watch a lower-quality, grade-B movie. I've been running into quite a few of those lately, and they've given me a greater appreciation for those who are experts in the entertainment industry.So I give a lot of credit to the well-known actors in this movie. They're the biggest reason that I was able to enjoy this movie to any real degree. Had they been no-name, amateur actors, with limited skill, this movie would have been terrible.

It's becoming a trope of netflix films. Decent actors, nice looking cinematography, abysmal script/screenplay. I couldn't tell you what this film is about. Hathaway is perfectly fine as usual, but who knows what this film is trying to do with her. It's confusing and just bad.

reviews.review_title: I'm not quite getting why so many people are slamming this movie.
reviews.content: Yes, the story is occasionally overwhelmed. Yes, certain plot beats feel forced, convenient and rushed. But, this is not a bad film, regardless of what people are saying.This film is well-made, beautifully shot, technically innovative and stylistically bold. The general reviews that have bombarded 'The Last Thing He Wanted' are false and dry, irrespective of how this film was produced, alongside the sheer amount of work and effort it took in creating it.Anne Hathaway provides the screen with one of her most fantastic, compelling, and bold of performances. If you don't want to see the film solely on the reviews it has received, at least see it as a demonstration of sheer acting drive and authenticity. She is an incredible actress/actor that always excites, develops and provides across her work.'The Last Thing He Wanted' seems to force a vast range of sub-plots into the tight duration of its length, but for the first 2/3 of the film, it doesn't seem too problematic. Once in the final act, this is when plot beats seem forced and convenient to the story - characters suddenly appearing, re-introducing minor characters, forced relationships. But, this film still provides the audience with something new and engaging, especially upon a topic-matter that will at least entertain.Don't disregard the film. It is still deserving of your viewing, especially upon the sheer innovation and impressive style of the cinematography, production design and thrilling performance from the wonderful lead actress/actor, Anne Hathaway

reviews.review_title: Ok it was a little dry
reviews.content: But some background prep on the Reagan-era Iran-Contra Nicaragua stuff may be useful. The whole 1980s Central America stuff is confusing but I get the gist of the story, a journalist gets drawn into a shady arms deal for her estranged Dad and meanwhile there's some Washington Americans in suits up to no good. Funny that Costa Rica is now a regular tourist/retirement place.

Its the case of a trailer either misleading me or over hyping the film, because I am not going to lie , the trailer for this film was great which is far from what the actual film turned out to be.The main overriding feeling after viewing this boring mess is that I never cared about any of it........not the story , the characters..........any of it.Bless Anne Hathaway because she is trying her best but I'm sorry she couldn't help to save this film from being bland and boring. To be fair though I cant remember much about her character because nothing was sticking to me, everything was just washing over me. This is due to the incredibly slow pace and dullness of the script, I mean there is just nothing appealing about this film at all. The same goes to Ben Affleck and William Dafoe both trying there best but even those two great actors as well cant save it.The main problems are a story that could be interesting , riveting and suspenseful, but its laid out in this almost surgical manor that tries to explain everything so convoluted and all over the place that it becomes uninteresting really quickly.This film had all the ingredients for a great film.........decent director , fairly interesting premise/story , great cast and a great trailer.................but instead it was all thrown away for this almost B-movie like documentary film.........I don't know anymore , I don't care at all.Overall its 30% out of 100 its a bad film again from Netflix , unfortunately they do put out some stinkers..........very occasionally do they get it right but when they do they definitely do........you cant win all the time..........this is a perfect example of that, don't bother wasting your time with this one.....totally un-re-watchable and forgettable...........I never cared about any of it what so ever !!

reviews.review_title: Sadly, a great opportunity is missed
reviews.content: It's unfortunate that the work of the great Joan Didion, who wrote the novel that this film is based on, is cut off at the knees by--of all things--the screen play. One disadvantage, viewers won't be schooled in the Iran-Contra scandal, which was a murky, poorly reported, hastily forgotten major episode in the Reagan administration, almost leading to his impeachment. So, at the onset of the story there's too much backstory that's a mystery to the audience.Didion's unparalleled reporting of the crisis in Central America was penned as a novel of her experiences during the time. And the filmmakers put together a superb cast to illustrate a novel whose style is challenging (more than most) to translate into a film. The central character played by Anne Hathaway (demonstrating here she needs a strong director and didn't get one), and that character makes choices that don't really comport with logic or anything remotely convincing. Today's film-goer is skilled in the hazards of the drug and arms trade of Central America, and even the most naive person wouldn't put themselves in the situation here.The screenplay is also negligent in defining who the cast of characters are and what their history has been. Ben Affleck's role is particularly poorly rendered. We simply assume he has a major role only because he's Ben Affleck. He drops in and out of the story in a confusing manner, and towards the end Hathaway's character shows a familiarity with him that isn't based on anything we've seen or been told. You can almost hear the audience ask in unison: "Huh? Did the leave out a reel?"Since Hathaway's character is pulled from investigating what she suspects is an illegal arms trade backed by the United States, the coincidence of discovering her alienated, alcoholic father is the very person behind it is too "literary" to be convincing. And what leads the character into the crisis at the heart of the film--entering the drug deal in lieu of her ill father to somehow redeem their relationship and further her investigative reporting to boot--is just too contrived to make sense. It can work on the pages of a book, but not as presented here. For a great example of how a film can succeed with material like this, see 1982's "The Year of Living Dangerously."Other than Hathaway's often hollow too hasty reading of her lines, the cast is excellent and the production crew superb. But the screen adaption is so flawed you wonder why anyone even tried to realize it. This certainly won't damage Joan Didion's literary reputation, but it's unfortunately the filmmakers let an opportunity pass of furthering it.

I can't believe the amount of bad reviews this movie is getting?

I tend to rate movies slightly higher than the average. I'm a hopeful optimist who is easily seduced by above average movies.. but this one completely confused and dissapointed and has my lowest ever movie rating.
Very disappointing and a waste of money.

Netflix has been on a roll these past few years. While changing the idea of how television can be consumed, the streaming giant has also financed dozens of films from revered auteurs and budding talent. This level of investment has paid dividends with films such as "The Irishman'' and "Roma." But like all portfolios, there are some stinkers such as "Bright" and "The Ridiculous 6" that blemish the hits. Joining the latter pile of garbage is the newest film to be dumped unceremoniously on Netflix: "The Last Thing He Wanted."A journalist for "The Atlantic Post," Elena McMahon made her mark with hard-hitting investigative pieces detailing the revolutions in 1980s Central America. One day, her secretive father attempts to reconnect with her after years apart. It's revealed he's rekindling their relationship because he has fallen victim to Alzheimer's. With his final days winding down, he confesses that he is a gun smuggler for the Nicaraguan Contras and asks her to complete his final deal. To fulfill her father's dying wish, Elena must go back to the place where everything began for her. Only this time, she's on the opposite side of the law than she was before.Re-teaming with Netflix after the critical success of "Mudbound," director Dee Rees makes some of the most shocking failures a respected filmmaker could make.Her command of the material is nonexistent as the plot and characters move along without any rhyme or reason. For a two hour movie (that feels twice as long), Rees offers little in terms of suspense and subtlety. The choppy editing lacks any cohesiveness between its revolving door of throwaway characters and locations.Even when Rees is supplied with quality supplemental material, such as the score by Tamar-kali, she cues it at the most obvious times, turning it against her intentions.Rees does throw in a nice camera movement every once in a while, but it's painfully obvious that it's only being done to try and cover-up the catastrophe that is being filmed. An example is the laughably bad final shot that looks ripped straight from a parody movie.Adapted by Rees and Marco Villalobos from the book of the same name, "The Last Thing He Wanted" is one of the most incomprehensible movies ever made. I would feel safe betting someone a billion dollars to watch this movie and then properly explain what they had just seen.The dialogue is both cliched and flowery as it makes even the smallest detail hard to comprehend. Characters speak English in a way so cryptic that it seems they aren't even speaking English at all. No amount of rewinding or looking through a dictionary could help me understand what exactly someone was saying. Fortunately, the poor sound mixing makes half of the dialogue muddled, saving me from further anguish.Also part of the problem is the script's overabundance of half-baked storylines and details. I would say that almost every one of these plots and subplots is filled with holes, but I'm not sure of what the plot was, to begin with. Characters and locations come and go, barely leaving a mark on the overall narrative. That is, until the end when Rees wraps a dozen different things up in the final three minutes, ending the film in a pile of disjointed pieces that produces more questions than answers.I know it's a tired trope to say that a movie should have been a mini-series, but this seriously should have been a mini-series.Anne Hathaway is mediocre as our supposedly tough main character. Hathaway tries her best, but she is woefully miscast and can't muster a sliver of enough fortitude to convince us of her believability.Ben Affleck plays a CIA agent hot on Elena's trail. Affleck seems to have been on set for less than a week and has as much energy as someone who just woke up from a nap after downing a bottle of NyQuil. Factoring in his minuscule screen time, it's safe to say that the main reason he was cast was to put his name on the poster.Playing the ailing father is Willem Dafoe, who has recently been on a career resurgence. Disappointingly, Dafoe falls into the type of hammy overacting that plagued the middle third of his career."The Last Thing He Wanted" is a glaring misfire on the careers of the usually dependable cast and crew. It will surely land on many "worst of the year" lists and may even take the top spot on a few. Thinking about this awful movie is the last thing I ever want to do.

reviews.review_title: Great photography and design... Too bad the rest of the movie is so completely bad that you can't even appreciate that after a while.
reviews.content:
Before we started I told my darling... "Good actors and the title reminds me of very good films:
There will be Blood, We have to talk about Kevin, Things we lost in the fire..."
So I imagined this would good... It was far far from good... I was almost ashamed for all those involved.
The Last thing he wanted.
What was the last thing who wanted?Reading a screenplay won't give an idea of the end result to actors... The film comes together with the directing, photo, light, set design, styling, music and of course editing... Seems to me the actors read an intriguing story and believed the director to pull it off... Well she dropped the ball... I mean really everyone else in the team seems to have delivered. Great visuals, good sound design, editing also was very smooth... Without a director having a clear vision and style this just became a huge mess.Had I been Netflix I would have taken the losses and not released this film. A scandal by any measure... Poor William Dafoe I'm thinking, must be thinking "worse decision of my career"...Had I been the director I would have used my own money recut this film to make it right. I really think it could have been a lot better...One thing I loved was reading the funny reviews here... You guys killed me. I was laughing out loud... So thanks so much for that :)

Tried to watch it the first time but fell asleep half way as I couldn't follow the story line. Watched it second time but stopped half way as I got bored! Finally tried watching it for the third time, trying to find the meaning of the film but Can't follow the film from the start! 2 stars are for the cast!
I want to comment about this movie. But I can't find the right words. 2 hours of absurdity. I suppose the ones who shot the movie, forgot the watch it back before releasing ... Terrible.

As many other reviewers stated, the story is impossible to follow. The reason is that literally every person in this movie has hidden motives. You never get to know when something happens, why it happens. Someone kills another person. Why does this guy want the other guy dead? You never get an answer. At a point she's in a car and another car with armed men who have been on screen for a few seconds before starts tailing her. The problem? Who is that guy? Why does he follow her? And that goes on and on.Again every character is a mystery, all of their motives are unclear, and by the end you just stop caring.Avoid!
This was a terrible movie with a great cast so it's almost painful to see how those talents and resources got wasted.

"I just want audiences to feel regret at the end and a sense of loss." ~Dee Rees, Director.In that case, job well done. I regret having watched it and feel that I've lost 2 hours of my life that I'll never get back.

It started out well for the first half hour, but the last 90 minutes was a horrendous mess that had me wondering where the plot went. Just disjointed filler that makes you angry for taking two hours of your life. So many plot gaps and bad characters. Who writes this garbage?

All those supposedly great actors in a 4.3 rated film.
Are they so greedy as to let themselves down, just for cash?
Looks like they are :-(

Netflix....what's up? You're usually pretty good. This was a complete waste of my time, your time and the actors and crew in the movie. Keep making garbage like this and you'll lose subscribers very very fast.....please, someone in quality control, pay attention.

reviews.review_title: How I described the movie to a group text
reviews.content: Me- Don't watch that new Ben Affleck movieD- Which one, that dumb basketball one?Me- No the one with cat woman girl, Sandinista drug thing cia, he kills her at the end...spoiled now you can't watchS- Jesus that was the worst descriptionMe- Believe it or not that was the best description of that movie ever, that's how bad it was

reviews.review_title: Loved the leads... not the film
reviews.content: I didn't get most of the story, but each of the leads was so watchable. They just carried the film. What a shame I didn't understand who their characters were or what they were doing most of the time. It does deserve better than 4.7 rating based on their performances, but it really fell far short of its potential.

reviews.review_title: Pathetic story, screenplay with a great cast
reviews.content: Guys in Netflix is this what we pay for ? Come on do some homework before you invest. This one is pure junk. Don't even think of watching this.
Terribls movie. Story doesn't make any sense and is super boring. Poor performance from main actors too...

It's as if the director/writer jumbled the scenes in the hope that a random order would make some sense. It didn't. A mess which purports to hint at some high level government conspiracy with the French -- of all people -- the good guys.I gave it zero stars because I couldn't find negative numbers.

We turned it off. We were consistently having to go back thinking we missed things only to find out we didn't miss anything it just wasn't explained. After about 45 minutes we realized we were both on our cell phones not even paying attention. We turned it off pretty quickly afterwards.
Shockingly awful. I've never regretted watching a film so much in my entire life. Absolutely shocking!
Honestly, I can't believe this exists. There is no plot just random scenes edited together. I just have no words for how completely nothing this "film" was.

reviews.review_title: How to make a short date night!
reviews.content: Put this on and you're guaranteed the date will be short. Characters, story and everything is just so bad, you will fly out of there quick. Unbelievable how these are made. They should of invested in bitcoin instead...
Poor script, disappointing preferences Form good actors, flat cinematography, they couldn't get anything right with this movie

reviews.review_title: Talented Cast & Very Interesting Plot, But Poor Execution
reviews.content: We have very interesting plot premise mixed with lots of acting talent. But, the end-product was poorly executed and leaves the viewer confused and disappointed. Nonetheless, once you start watching you will be drawn in and want to find out what happens. Unfortunately, the "how" and the "why" could've and should've been handled with greater care amd and ingenuity. I feel like this story would have had a clearer and more effective outcome if the story had been "fleshed out" deeper into a miniseries.

No suspension of disbelief whatsoever. Tough journalist from DC writes about the shady US involvement during the Reagan administration in arming the contras and similar anti-democratic forces in Middle America only to find herself brokering a hefty arms deal for her estranged and sick dad. Huh?
If the role of Anne Hathaway was a investigative reporter and wanted to know the truth. How come she never knew what her father was doing, all this time?????

reviews.review_title: Disjointed, confusing and an overall waste of time even during this pandemic
reviews.content: Do not make the same mistake as me by being hoodwinked by a stellar cast and the trailer. Its confusing, disjointed and character development is as missing as the plot. I was confused within the first 30 minutes and thought it will explain itself but it got more confusing.Random names just get thrown about all over the place. Anne Hathaway tries her best, but there's no rescuing this jumbled, all over the place film.Avoid at all costs - even during the Covid 19 this will feel like you have wasted valuable time.
Absolutely zero value. You can do better with your time.Watching pain dry and grass grow is more interesting.
Hathaway over-acted part. Movie was discombobulated. So disappointing
Pitiful convoluted and dreadful story. Stopped watching half way through just couldn't stand anymore.

First movie to take serious El Salvador and the conflict we suffered during the 80s. EU did have an important impact in la Fuerza Armada actions. Is very difficult to follow the plot and script of the movie

What was all this about? Pointless story. I've been waiting the whole time for this to pick up and deliver a story but you are being left wanting. It's like ordering food that never arrives. You mouth is watering but you get more And more frustrated the longer you wait, until you finally realise someone cancelled the order for you. Could've been nice, with nice cinematography and good actors but they tried to tell too many stories at once while finishing neither of these stories.

I'm not completely sure why everyone is saying this movie was hard to follow. It takes place in the 80s, which is made clear by many things happening: smoking in offices, Reagan running for president, the recent discovery of cocaine and guns being traded with the US.Anne Hathaway plays a journalist, but beyond that, she plays a single mother who has no choice but to send her daughter to boarding school due to her crazy work schedule... hmm, "Who chose money over life?" She plays a daughter herself; her parents are divorced, her mother is recently deceased, and her estranged father, whom she calls Dick, has been in and out of her life for years, choosing to focus on his mysterious "Supply Chain" career. By the looks of him, we can tell he's chosen alcohol, money, and drugs over being there for his daughter. And perhaps he's struggling with slight wet-brain dementia? We don't know for sure, nor do we know whether he's just putting on a farce.This movie made you think - at what level do we begin choosing money over life? Choosing work over family. Choosing to help your ailing father obtain a very illegal million dollar payout, only to realize he sent you to retrieve it because he knew how dangerous it was.The guns, the drugs, the politics... were all just additions to the plot of this story, in my opinion. Yes, it told a fascinating tale, and if you have zero knowledge of recent history, it could be hard to follow. But beyond that, this movie forces you to question who you can trust in life. It forces you to question the choices you make - "Why are you here?" It offers multiple escape points for Anne's character, all of which she refuses to accept, and we're left to wonder how differently things would have played out for her had she chosen the right people to trust.

reviews.review_title: Ok movie up to the end...
reviews.content:
Ok movie if you are multitasking.
The end had me disapointed and was very predictable.
Many scenes made no sense whatsoever.
TV series like Narcos tell a much better story in a much more eneterntaining way.
The acting is very good and the stars cannot be faulted.
It is simply that the story is very confusing with some key plotholes.
The first 5 minutes are particularly excruciating and can be fast forwarded.

I kept thinking is there something I'm
missing . Great cast and worst movie ! It's not just bad it's a shame

reviews.review_title: I hoped it was a poorly understood movie..
reviews.content: It's not. The only explanation I can find for the way the movie ended up is bad editing. It feels like a mash-up of sequences from 5 different movies, each one on its own of decent quality but alltogether going nowhere. The characters emotions and their relationships to each other are the real mistery in this movie. Any sense of closeness, sadness, intimacy, motivation portrayed aptly by the actors seems out of place, you constantly feel like you must have missed something or some important information was left out - it simply doesn't add up. It's honestly not worth the time or even the curiosity, it's not spectacularly bad just strangely alienating.

reviews.review_title: Thank god i skipped 80% of it
reviews.content: THE most boring movie i have ever seen so far. I literally had to go out of my way to give this movie a 1 star and a bad review so that other people doesn't have to go through the suffering of watching this movie.

... was to like this movie: great sets, beautiful shooting, very good actors. But it falls short because the story doesn't carry. It is simple (no, it's not confusing, just listen to it and you'll get it). But yet, this simple story has too much plot pressed into one movie length to be convincing and easy to follow. It should've been a mini series. Now it just falls flat with characters not developed, plots not elaborated. There is not enough depth given, on who does what and why, to make it tangible, to make viewers relate to the characters, to develop attachment, to root for them to fail or succeed. So after the movie I felt like after a five star restaurant meal that should've been an awesome feast, with all the bells and whistles, wine, top grade delicacies - but yet it wasn't right, not paired the right way, not fulfilling. It leaves me with some kind of anger about what could've been - but then it wasn't.

Marvellous Cast
I found the whole narrative confusing. Even if you can parse it out, it doesn't add up to a whole lot.
The viewer is lost in the middle of a plot in which the director and co-writer want to give few clues.

reviews.review_title: If you pay attention the movie kinda makes sense
reviews.content: So the reviews that I've seen in here are not favorable and if you just watch and really listen and pay attention to what is going on the movie kinda makes sense.

reviews.review_title: The Last Thing You Need to Watch
reviews.content: The first 10-20 minutes are very promising, a story based on real history events that still impacting the world, but when they introduce the father character -William Defoe- every thing becomes really confusing, it's really hard to follow the story or understand any move!! I don't know how the movie script was greenlit!!

reviews.review_title: Something to do with guns, Costa Rica, Nicaragua, cia
reviews.content: Just a bit of a mess.. guns, senators, smarmy Whitehouse guys, guns, drugs, newspapers, Costa Rica.. good lord all those things are in the film, I think.. just can't quite work out the order.

You dont need much history to know this movie is a vapid failure.The story is as old as reagan who at least traded drugs/guns/and Nicaragau peace for banana plantations?. The confused plotting and rather wooden acting wasted what talent may have been available. Ben Afleck is the standout wooden character in this one....... Anne Hathaway doomed from the beginning.... William Defoe has this special "agent" role he has done too many times before.This is not entertaining or worth the time...though Netflix has such a poor list available scanning, and only getting worse, this may be another typical waste there.Couldn't there have been some scenery that at least made the country look interesting and jungly?I read that even Nicholas Cage bailed on this project...Maybe he has some sensibility in the rolls he rejects.....
What; wait; really?? This is so bad I found myself continually thinking I missed something. Surely no one could knowingly produce such a bad film. Don't waste your time. RUN!!

Honestly have no idea what I just watched. What started as a seemingly straightforward 'hustle gone wrong' movie turned into a confusing and strange wannabe thriller. Genuinely haven't got a clue what the storyline was

What the hell did they trick me into by putting Ben affleck in this crap!! Why did I even waste 1/2 hour of my already boring life to attempt a seriously boring and confusing movie . 100% garbage.netflix can't get it right no matter who stars in there movie!

Pointless waste of time.
No idea what it was trying to say, who was who, what their roles, motivations were.
A complete and utter mess of a movie.
Life is too short to waste on such mediocre movie.

reviews.review_title: NEITHER THE DIRECTOR NOR WRITER READ THE NOVEL
reviews.content: Reading the novel will not make this convoluted mess of a movie any clearer. The director and/or screenplay writer seem to have gotten so embarrassed at their inadequacies that they just chucked the novel's eerie ending and added their own which is so silly it might show contempt for Joan Didion's book. Ann Hathaway doesn't bore us here with endless suffering, but she's not able to bring life to flaky, doomed Elena McMahon. Ben Affleck, a frozen asset, might have delivered his most cigar-store-Indian performance, yet. Since Rosie Perez's character isn't in the novel we can't say anything about her in this one.It wasn't going to be easy to adapt "The Last Thing He Wanted." Why did they trash the material, though? Several years ago Campbell Scott had a project going to adapt Didion's "Book of Common Prayer." I don't think it would have worked, either, especially with the cast he'd chosen, but it might have been better than what was done to "The Last Thing He Wanted."

reviews.review_title: Down-Below/Up Over Cowboy/Bad Actor Waging War/Lying Through Hollywood Gop Teeth
reviews.content: At 70 I find myself increasingly at odds with 'self-appointed reviewers'...Try reading some Great writing...Joan Didion is Great & was there reporting on History w/wonderful Style/Eloquence & Insight!!! Wtf...I was there too read some recent History Kiddies...you are sadly out of your league & depths, but my oh my dont' we 'Love to Critique/Criticize...Great Historical True Story about Iran/Contra Affair..."Google for quick info...duh imho.

What a waste of a great cast. I had high hopes for this movie - but it was hard to follow, confusing and ultimately a complete letdown. The ending was pointless, in fact, the whole movie was pointless. Just complete Netflix garbage. Please don't waste 2+ hours of your life on this tripe.
Such a waste of time... 2 hours of confusing events and a really poor ending.

40 minutes...that's how long I lasted....that's 39 minutes more than I needed to see. For the life of me I have no idea what was going on. No movie should assume it's viewers are so aware of the story that they completely ignore setting plot points and story introductions. Fleeing a war torn country gives me nothing. So if someone can explain to me what the point of this film was I'd be grateful.
Nothing more to say about it. It was boring, it was jumping between different scenes without making any sense, and it looked like segments of different movies were stitches together

I'm not sure what this is about. What is the plot? I watched it and I'm not sure what it's about. It makes no sense at all. Don't waste your time. The acting is decent but what the hell is it about!?!?

I couldn't even finish it and I only had 20 minutes left. I finally decided that since I had no idea what the heck was going on it was OK to pull the plug. Who wrote this crap? And who the heck taught Anne Hathaway how to smoke? Both should be shot.

Anyone associated with this piece of utter garbage should have any licenses or credentials or certifications revoked. The actors names pull you in and you wait for something/anything to happen, connect ir make sense. This may possibly be THE worst movie ever inflicted on an innocent public. Hathaway, Affleck and Dafoe ought to be ashamed and offer $30 rebates ($15 an hour) to those who sat through this slog.

Up to a certain point the movie is watchable and you feel oh this is one of those where you have to pay attention. At some point you just go WTF is going on? Was I abducted by Aliens and lost time? Did I miss 40 minutes of movie? What happened here? And you just finish the movie to not lose the already invested time and then at the end you wish you would have stopped watching when your common sense said you should have.
I don't even understand how they allow a product like this to be released. It's just mind-blowing.
Horrible movie.
Do not expect the world just expect a watchable movie that has a few twists and turns and in the end is not bad!...critics suck

Wow. What a mess. Hathaway's opening narration is your first clue as to just how bad this film is going to be, and in fact, it actually sums up the entire debacle quite well. It's confusing, self-important, rambling, non-sensical, disjointed, tedious and just plain dull.And is it me, or was the volume of this film curiously low? At first I thought I was missing things because it wasn't loud enough, but I was missing things because the film is, well...missing things. Like a story.And to think this incredible cast signed on for this! Were they given a wonderful script and then it got all chopped up in the editing room? Were they tricked? Duped? Anne goes all in to flesh out a character, but I started to feel sorry for her after awhile that she was working so hard, not knowing that the ship was sinking. For an actor, that seriously has to suck.When all was said and done, I suspect the producers knew they had a bomb, so they lowered the volume hoping we'd just fall asleep and forget the whole thing. Which everyone will.I don't like giving bad reviews, but this was just so remarkable in its terribleness that it was worthy of comment. I guess that's something.

reviews.review_title: A complicated story doesn't make a good movie
reviews.content: I thought that this would be a high rated movie because of the top actors and the complicated story, but I'm relieved to read the actual reviews here. The story is confusing and unclear. It's like they had too much story and just half of the time. What the hell is this about? Why this abrupt ending? What happens after this?

reviews.review_title: Nice retrospection of a confusing life
reviews.content: The movie presents a retrospection fy a woman trying to understand what made something happening in a certain moment in her life. It is not a plot from point1 to point2 but a collection of events perhaps linked to each other. Anne Hathaway did an authentic role person - and so did Ben Affleck but in a minor way. From another point of view it is a story on how policy-making and crime are combined in the life of one person - trying to capture what is happening. The fragmentaries in the movie is presenting this - sometimes in not so nice pictures. The Last Things He Wanted is a much worth to watch!

reviews.review_title: Can I have my 2 hours back please...
reviews.content: This film had a lot of potential but never delivered. There are just too many gaps and no explanations on who any of the supporting characters were.But aside from that the story was just very flimsy. The main character herself even admitted in the film that she didn't even know why she was there.

I thought I was going to see Ben Affleck. But He barely appeared, maybe less than 5 mins. I didn't get what was his relation to Anne. It was hard to follow what is happening, or I lost my focus at an early time. Costumes and cinematography from the '80s are good. I don't recommend it. Putting ben to trailers or posters is misleading.

reviews.review_title: Don't believe anyone that rates this higher than a 3.
reviews.content:
One of the worst movies I have ever seen with good actors. Anyone one that rates it higher then a 8 goes off on a rant about the actual events and not the horrible movie made about those events. Unanswered questions, Who, What, How. Answered questions, When the 80s, Where South America. Add; Guns, drugs, war, government, journalists, family, cars, airplanes, jungle, ocean, words.
You just got as much out of it as I did during my last two hours.
Going to watch it again tomorrow night backwards and with the sound off to see if it makes more sense. I guessing it will.
Complete garbage, don't waste your time. Hard to connect all stories, most dont make sence

After reading low reviews, I thought it would be a terrible movie. Although it didn't go into deep discussions about everything, it came together in the end. If you really watch this movie and don't look at your phone, it's a pretty good movie.The acting is top notch and the scenery is beautiful and interesting. I loved the monochromatic matching outfits!

reviews.review_title: Netflix proves it has a lot to learn
reviews.content: Anne Hathaway really gave it her all in this mishmash of events. And there were a lot of good scenes of warlike destruction, but the ending wiped out any hope that this film may have had. Ben Affleck merely phoned his character in.

reviews.review_title: Top Name Actors Trying to Bank on Netflix Checks
reviews.content: Journalistic mystery type film set in the 80s. Styled like early 2000's journalistic films, but lacks the clarity and believability. There is little to no background on the scenarios the film depicts making the film incredibly disjointed. Final wrap up gave some closure, so if you want to watch the first 5 minutes, jump to the middle 10 minutes, then close with the last 3 minutes, you get the same movie.
If I could have rated a zero I would have. Even a negative if at all possibly. Horrible writing

reviews.review_title: If you're IQ is above average you most likely can and will enjoy this movie :)
reviews.content: Don't understand all the bad reviews. Good acting? Yes! Good cinematography? Yes! Good story? Yes! Good script? Yes!If you attention span is greater than that of a child you should be able follow the story line as well which is not the average over simplistic linear one for brain dead people.Great movie! Chapeau :)
Anne is the worst tv smoker I've seen yet. Perhaps it's down to laws in the states wrt smoking at work, but bloody hell I was a better smoker at 13 than she is now!

I've seen movies before with incoherent plots - and this movie certainly has that-, but I think this might be the first movie I've seen that actually morphs. It actually reminds me of the scene in Terminator 2 where the liquid metal terminator thrashes wildly, displaying in quick succession all the faces he's assumed since landing in our world. This is like a cinematic version of that, with the plot thrashing wildly, showing in quick, fragmented succession, showing an investigative journalist, a daring idealist, a political cynic, an alienated daughter, wife, and mother, a gun runner, a blubbering floozy having casual sex with an associate of George Schultz, CIA intrigue, ..., and so on and so on. Along with occasional, out of character, poetic narrative.You might be tempted by the impressive cast. But a dozen celebrities cannot make up for a disjointed script. The acting was OK but not exceptional, which makes sense since the actors probably had no better idea what the movie was about than we do. Except that it looks like they were only willing to pay Ben Affleck for his Economy acting package, which unfortunately does not include facial expressions or emoting.

I normally don't write reviews but this movie definitely deserves one to the most boring film I have seen.
The narrative is such a mess, there is no clear indication of who the characters really are and why they are making such decisions. It jumps from place to place the story and we clearly can't understand why Anne Hathaway keeps making such terrible decisions.
Acting unfortunately accompanied with a terrible script and a bad director means the film has a terrible after taste.
How can I get my time back? You simply can't.
So do yourself a favour and don't watch this.

I had high hopes for the movie. A movie based on a great book with an all-star cast, and directed by Dee Rees! What could possibly go wrong?! Well, pretty much everything. The movie version of the story was impossible to follow, the cast gave subpar performances, the setting of Central America was somehow boring and mundane, the score was forgettable, and the movie overall was excruciatingly boring and pointless. If I spare even one person the misery of suffering through this two painful hours, I will consider this review worthwhile.
Just like so many other users I was not- despite having watched till the very end- able to follow the storyline nor understand the motives of the characters. However superb acting by Anne Hathaway.
Intimate take on issues still relevant. Don't understand why people think it's confusing. It's quite clear to me.
Good story, but it wasn't adapted well. It was scattered, predictable and a waste of my time.

reviews.review_title: Turn On, Take A Nap, Wake Up, & You've Missed Nothing
reviews.content: The movie starts out being long winded and out of breath. It's a total waste of big name actors / actresses. The whole movie you'll have no idea what's going on. When it ends, you still won't know.

I feel bad for doing this because the acting was really good by all the actors. But Cmon. The story was so bad. Great actors and great everything else except for story that went every where except for a place that made any sense.

What happens if you start with a complex historical/political story that (presumably) makes logical sense, but take out the exposition and replace it with poetic, stream-of-consciousness dialog that sounds intelligent but explains nothing? You end up with a movie that can only be comprehended by someone who already knows what it's about some other way (by, I guess, reading the book on which it is based, or maybe telepathy).Anne Hathaway is pretty good as a tenacious reporter who gets too involved in a story she's investigating. Before long, though, she's making decisions that seem insanely risky, and then, not long after that... I can't even tell you, because I couldn't follow what was happening.I wanted to like this movie, because it seemed smart and challenging - like maybe All The President's Men meets Chinatown - but either I'm not smart enough (which is certainly possible) or the movie is incoherent nonsense (much more likely).

Within 10 minutes I realised nothing in this film made any sense. I decided it would be more beneficial and enjoyable for me to watch the paint dry on my walls. Despite some good actors it fails to make any impression. Do not bother with it.

Avoid at all costs.It isn't worth any critical review.Boring.
Bad acting.
They graphically blow up a dog who was the only thing of interest in the first half of the movie despite only being on the screen for maybe 20 frames.
Horrific writing.Just don't do it. Even if you have consumed EVERY conceivable form of media on the planet, don't watch this time wasting garbage.

Bad acting, bad script, and they graphically blow up a dog. Painfully clumsy exposition, and sub par on all fronts. It seems that when a movie can't manage to use a story, or otherwise craft tension, that they will graphically kill an animal to set the mood.I wasted an hour of my life on this (I bailed when they blew up the only interesting thing in the movie - a random background dog). Oh god it's such a bad movie it's not worth any form of analysis. Hope you got a good pay check for this excrement.

I'm 3/4 of the way through this movie so I feel like I MUST finish it but I'm quietly wishing a coma would kick in for the last 30 minutes. So much potential, but the script is reminiscent of Rachel making her trifle on Friends...one scene does not lead into the next scene with any coherence, so I'm assuming at some point a number of pages were stuck together. There are top notch actors in this movie, did they read the script? Or did they have one of their lackeys read it for them and give them a 10 second summary? I sat here watching thinking I cannot be the only person who is extremely confused right now and so of course I came here and at least I know I'm not alone.
I'm contemplating watching again to see if I missed something but I can't imagine doing so...
Dirt. Why can I not give 0 stars? It deserves 0 stars. It could deserve negative stars because I expected more of this cast. Sadly.....prostituted themselves in this instance.
Phone was down the entire movie so we were definitely paying attention. Yet we managed to be lost through most of the movie. Why? It had potential to be a great story but I was written terribly.

Wasted a whole 2 hours watching this movie. A bigg noo for me, really what were they thinking while making this movie?! No proper plot or story or anything, highly recommend to not watch this movie and waste 2 hrs.

Easily the most annoying, confusing and outright worst movie of 2020 next to Artemis Fowl, Cuties and The Grudge. With a dull script, one note characters, lackluster ending, poor pacing, bad soundtrack and sloppy editing. Also it's easily the worst Affleck/Hathaway movie ever. The book was decent, but the movie was ruined just like The Last Days of American Crime . It tried way too hard at being a thriller, in this case a crime/political one. Don't waste your time. There are plenty of good movies and TV shows on Netflix, there are so many good ones. And the pacing is bad, running at 115 minutes which is too long and it feels slow and painful to look, just like The Lodge or even 365 Days.

reviews.review_title: Worst and most pointless movie I have ever seen
reviews.content:
No storyline, no suspense. I never stopped watching a movie, but I am writing this while it is running in the background.
This movie is a total waste of time!

reviews.review_title: Terrible. Great actress needs to pay he rent.
reviews.content: An overly complicated movie set in the beautiful Caribbean. Hiding from hit men. Whom to trust. Terrible ending. (I hope it's merely loosely based on the Joan Didion novel of the same name, which I haven't read.)A Truman Capote-like hotel owner. (Maybe the actor prepared by watching those Capote bio movies from a few years back. But Philip Seymour Hoffman was better.)Skip this or see it to see the worst movie by pre-eminent Ms. Hathaway.

reviews.review_title: Even if you know the history, this movie is still a POS!
reviews.content: The screenplay should have exploded on that land mine instead of the dog.There are a lot of positive reviews of this monstrosity trying to make out that if you know the history, you'll get the story. Trust me, even if you do, you won't.You've been warned!

I am surprised by how negative most reviews are. The movie was fast-paced and two hours flew by. Willem Defoe made a brilliant supporting role. I thought Anne Hathaway's character was captivating.True - I could have done with some more explanation of the political background, or what was going on, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the movie.

I gave up on the movie with 10 minutes to go, it was that bad I couldn't watch anymore. I always look at IMDb before watching a movie but I thought I wouldn't this time and decided for myself. I WILL NEVER MAKE THAT MISTAKE AGAIN.
Something does not come together, and difficult even to understand
I dont know what i have seen... cant understand anything... lost of time
I was hoping this movie would be good considering all the big name stars in it but turned out to be one of the worst movies I've ever seen and an hour & a half of my life that I won't get back.

Anyone could think with the protagonists, the result of this movie could be reasonably good... Well, it's a disaster!
Bad camera management, bad characterization and very bad dialogue.
The rescue could be Hathaway's performance, but not even that ... This is the worst thing I saw of her ...
Dont bother! Actors are great but doesn't help much when the storyline is non existent and boring!

I feel like people are being unnecessarily critical of this movie. Is it Anne Hathaway's best performance? Maybe not, but the movie is still good. It has a good storyline and isn't dragged out. Just relax and enjoy the movie for what it is. You kinda get the sense that the average reviewer tried to make the movie something it's not. Going in without watching the trailer, or look on IMDb I thoroughly enjoyed it!

reviews.review_title: Horrible screenplay, could not follow plot
reviews.content: What a waste of acting talent. With 15 minutes left in the movie I finally turned it off because I had no clue what the plot was, none of it made any sense. One of the worst screenplays ever,
Just BAD ! It could have become a great-thrilled and exciting TV series ... but instead the director made it to a movie. It left many things unexplained and unsolved. Just disappointed!

reviews.review_title: Total waste of time and talent
reviews.content: Kept waiting for a storyline to follow but it just meandered into a total confusing mess.

Great potential here with the cast, but writers crammed 40 years of cold war central American interdiction into 10 seconds bits expecting the audience to understand and the characters had no development. This would have made a great series as there is so much (real) history behind the story to unpack and inform an audience.

reviews.review_title: So little time so many bad movies
reviews.content: With so little time this movie deserves very little of yours. Anne Hathaway's acting is excellent. As for the rest of the movie you get a prize if you can follow the storyline and figure it out. This movie is the sure cure for insomnia. Skip it and keep your sanity.

reviews.review_title: I have absolutely no idea what this movie was about.

Scenes appear randomly sorted, narration is badly written stream-of-consciousness nonsense delivered as if it was an homage to Joe Friday, and there's frequent on-screen tags that absolutely don't help you understand what the hell is going on. I don't know who wrote the dialogues but all the characters sound like a whiny version of Sheldon Cooper, including Ben Affleck.To make it even worse, it's more of the same post-metoo fodder we've been inundated with lately: bad guys are white males, the real heroes are a white woman and her semi-diverse sidekick, but the script could have worked with the Mel Gibson/Danny Glover duo without changing anything except pronouns. Of course, throw in a few jabs at conservatives for good measures, because Reagan.
Agree with most of the reviews, I couldn't follow the story.

When you go to a five-star restaurant, you expect a five-star meal. If, at the end of your dining experience, you find yourself feeling unsatisfied, your review of it will get an extra edge of harshness. I think this explains to a large extent why users and critics are attacking this movie with such little restraint.I do agree that there are many things that could have been done better, but I think that rating it anything below 4 must be a result of the emotion I described above, and doesn't do the movie any justice.I believe that with a different approach to the script and the buildup of the movie, the results might have been better. I guess it's always a challenge to try and "do a book". I'm pretty sure Dee Rees was aware of that, as she described Joan Didion's book as 'fragmented' and 'jumping around in time'. Since watching a movie is an entirely different experience compared to reading a book, choices must be made to clear up that fragmentation. It seems that Rees wanted to stay true to the novel, more than is good for her movie.The result of this approach has been that established and experienced actors do not end up placed in the story in a way that allows them to shine and display their best talents. The ever-charming Anne Hathaway still did an acceptable job, but that's the thing. Your lead protagonist has to shine, always. There just aren't many exceptions to this rule, in much the same way as the lead vocal in a song has to be stable and clear in order for any song to be appreciated by its listeners.This could have been a really good movie. You have the budget, you have a strong cast, you have great locations, you have good cinematography, and, let's not forget this: you have a good story. Yes, a good story. It's just hard to follow, and you can remedy that by reducing the disjointedness that apparently worked for the book, but pretty much buries the story if you use the same approach for a movie.I'm sure that Dee Rees will learn a lot from this experience, and I am confident she will give continue to give us great movies in the future. I still have a good degree of sympathy for this film, which is why I rated it six stars. I didn't feel like I wasted my time. I had a meal that satisfied my hunger, but not the expectations that I started it with.

Seeing all those destroying reviews surprised me bit, although not totally. The Last Thing He Wanted is the kind of movie that you cannot watch unprepared. In fact the movie should have considered that all people did not read the original novel, and do not necessary know much about geopolitics.
I did not read the novel, and I admit I had a hard time trying to understand all the events and details as the story went on. It was clear, however, that the main character Elena was investigating sensitives affairs in central America, which represented a threat to important politicians in the US.
The profile of Elena is clearly the one of an extremely audacious woman, ready to risk her life for her cause. When she arrives in Nicaragua and things do not happen as planned, she chooses to stay in an extremely hostile place to dig deeper in the subject, instead of running back to her airplane back home, something anyone with a minimum sense of survival instinct would have done. (Personally I wouldn't even have entered the plane to begin with, but yes I'm a coward).
Then all the atmosphere of mess, chaos and paranoia is actually thrilling, imo. The fact that we do not know exactly where she is and who are the friends and who are the enemies translates what the main character probably felt. Anyone is potentially an enemy willing to kill you. I was curious to see how would or how could she get out of such a degenerated situation. Well she didn't.
The story makes you wonder, in fact, why did she go on that trip, and why did she stay, if it was for the money, for the cause, or for both. I would guess for both.The movie failed to keep the audience connected due to a complete lack of clear illustration and explanation of the context, I was extremely frustrated not being able to fully understand who were some character, and what was exactly happening in some scenes.But I think the story caught my attention, and I think I learned a couple of new things about some events that were going one in the Reagan era, involving politics and interests concerning Central America.

A slow start. But as it went through became very good! Maybe a 7/10 and at best and 8/10. It had great potential. But when the film had its big reveal. It was a massive letdown. The 'Big Villain' was a a fail. Badly linked. Not very well connected. Loose ends left with multiple questions

reviews.review_title: Only for people with stamina and who've done their 'homework' 1st
reviews.content:
I believe this movie would have a much higher average rating here on IMDb if the producers had shown a disclaimer at start of it like:"If your historic awareness of US Foreign Policy doesn't go beyond Rambo-style action movies, to understand the reality of 'Super Power' involvement into the Middle Americas (a/o Vietnam, Irak and Afghanistan), we'd suggest you do your homework first or skip this movie all-together!"Therefore I very much agree with most people here giving this movie a 10/10 only to compensate for the 1/10 'bashers'!I consider this a rare - almost arthouse style - 'real' movie, narrating just another example of the 'dark side of humanity' theme: i.e. political power 'games' and greed fuelled parasitism at the expense of anything.DOP is done in a visually very authentic and real way: it feels as dirty as it's plot at the 'Reagan' era this took or could have taken place!Sadly, the amount of detailled narrative is (too) much and complex to squeeze into a 'just' 2 hour movie. Especially if you lack advised historic background AND advanced concentration skills to stay hooked for this amount of time.Although the bottom line theme was quite clear to me while watching this movie, I too felt puzzled, disconnected and somewhat frustrated trying to understand in details all characters and plot-twists while watching it.This is not a straight forward 'popcorn' movie, you really must be knowledgeable and engaged to 'enjoy' it. 'Enjoyment' for me only in an intellectual way grasping the sad point this movie is trying to make in a hard way, since the conclusion and the end makes you feel sorry for humanity and the journalist.Nonetheless, I think this movie is a brave attempt at times only the easy to digest 'movies for knuckleheads' seem to receive good ratings.

reviews.review_title: No light entertainment - needs your full attention and probably multiple viewings.
reviews.content: I watched this movie as I usually watch movies, without doing any background reading or watching trailers etc. first. I prefer not to be primed to take a movie in any particular way and keep an open mind. So I just sort of casually watched this movie, and I really did not like it. Disjointed, obscure plot, unintelligible blathering, etc. Read all the reviews, same, so, bad movie, period.Except that there was a little voice in me saying hey you did not try very hard to understand this movie, in fact you did not try at all. So I gave it a second try, and frankly, I had a much better experience. I watched it a third time, and seriously, I am beginning to warm up to this movie.Truth is, you won't enjoy his movie while stuffing your face with popcorn, chatting to your friends on your mobile phone, and doing 10 other things at the same time. This is just simply not that kind of movie. It needs your full attention and probably multiple viewings. Add some research on the context. It doesn't entertain as much as it challenges. If you are not OK with that, this movie is not for you, and you'll probably be disappointed. If you are OK with that or even appreciate a movie like that, you will probably like it.Thing is, I hardly ever see a movie that I even remotely consider watching again. This one I have watched three times so far. So, it can't be that bad, can it. If there is one thing I question now, that is the producers' choice to make this particular book into a movie. Probably not the easiest task, and they did a good job at it, but yes, this will never be a blockbuster. Most people watch movies for light entertainment, to switch off, not to switch on. This movie is so condensed, you can't just breeze through it.

Let's just put it that way, the trailer makes more sense than the movie itself. It had everything to give me high hopes about this movie: the spooky stuff, arms deals in Central America, the political intrigue, a great casting... what a disappointment and a waste of time... so much is taken for granted that doesn't make sense when you head into the movie... anyway let's just forget I just lost 2h of my life and hope better movies will ale me forget this one

reviews.review_title: Mixed Up Worse Than A Dog's Breakfast
reviews.content:
How anyone got this mishmash from Joan Didion's book, of the same name, is beyond me!
I've read the book so I knew the context but nothing was explained in this film.
Anne Hathaway, who I think is an amazing actress, was given a one dimensional character. One who cries every few minutes and makes the poorest choices. There is no rhyme or reason for what she does.
Characters pop up out of nowhere, you have no idea what or why or who. They are there, usually with a gun.
Onata Aprile plays Anne's daughter Cat,. You only see her on the phone talking to Anne. You are given no background on their relationship.
The fantastic cast couldn't fix this movie, when given this terrible screenplay to work with.
What a loss,as the book was great and so much more could have been fleshed from its' pages for this film. This is just a rushed, jumble that should be an embarrassment for all involved!

Besides the terrible storyline, the confusing scenes and the lack of any apparent logic, I am most outraged about the dog scene. I mean, blowing up a dog is simply unforgiveable. Clearly it was intended to shock people, look how bad these people are that she is dealing with. But all it did was offend me that they felt the need to put this pointless and cruel act in the movie. Honestly I would have been fine if Elena would have been put in that scene instead and killed on the spot. It would have saved me from watching the rest of this disaster.
